Pov3D.display
Class POVDisplay

java.lang.Object
  Pov3D.util.ProcessingObject
      Pov3D.display.POVDisplay

public class POVDisplay
extends ProcessingObject

POVDisplay the main class that corresponds to a physical POV Display see http://furiousgreencloud.com/pov/ for complete general documentation

Author:
Brady Marks (furiousgreencloud@gmail.com)

Constructor Detail

POVDisplay

public POVDisplay(java.lang.String deviceIP)
The simplest Constructor of a POVDisplay object see the POVDisplay(String deviceIP, int sliceCount) for a complete description this version creates Util.MAX_SLICES (150) slices , by default.

Parameters:
deviceIP - a string like "10.10.1.99", this is the IP given out by your router to the display via DHCP
See Also:
POVDisplay(String deviceIP, int sliceCount)

POVDisplay

public POVDisplay(java.lang.String deviceIP,
                  int sliceCount)
The preferred Constructor a POVDisplay, you'll likely just need one (global).

Parameters:
deviceIP - a string like "10.10.1.99", this is the IP given out by your router to the display via DHCP
sliceCount - the number of slices you want the display to use, 80 is a safe number you could get up to 120 if your 3D models are simple. The higher the number the more "resolution" you get. i.e. The Display will try to draw more slices as it spins. The current slice that it draws is always the best slice calculated from the current time, so are possibility skipped, with little adverse effects. the slice count is limited to Util.MAX_SLICES (150)
Method Detail

callReceiveHandler

public void callReceiveHandler(byte[] data)
Receive Data Handler This is a stub, the display does not send any data back to the processing sketch.

clear

public void clear()
clear out voxels from display object, similar to background() in processing. Note: clear does NOT reset the matrixStack as you might not want to do that. As you draw into the display object, the object accumulates VOXELs (Volume Elements) which are then sent to the display when the export() method. After that you SHOULD clear() the display object with this method, otherwise you will accumulate voxels and the display with eventual become solidly lit

See Also:
export(), resetMatrix()

export

public void export()
Send current Volume to the POV display this should happen often enough for the animation to happen but not so often as to overwhelm the display. In practice this is every 80-250 ms for a Volume/Animation rate of 12.5 to 4 volumes per second.

                   float y,

Parameters:
x - float from -50.0 to 50.0

sphere

public void sphere(processing.core.PVector pos,
                   int size)
Light up a series of poins in the POVDisplay object, to form a sphere, ALSO draws a white sphere on the sketch canvas. Internal uses the Pov3D.shape.Sphere object

Parameters:
pos - a PVector point, for the center of the sphere
size - (int) the radius of the sphere
See Also:
SpherePov3D.shape.Sphere

project

public processing.core.PVector project(processing.core.PVector p)
Process a PVector point (p) into it's final position via the stacked matrixes inside the POVDisplay object, and then return that point.

Parameters:
p - Point (PVector)
Returns:
PVector at it's final resting place

dot

public boolean dot(YPoint yp,
                   int c)
Light a Dot on the display, a YPoint unlike a PVector is not translated and rotated on the matrix stack. Likley you don't want to use this method but rather dot(PVector p) or dot(x,y,z), it is used by other shape primitive to draw more directly in the display object. ALSO draws a point onto the canas of colout c

Parameters:
yp - (YPoint) direct point to light
c - colour of point on canvas
Returns:
true if the point is currently in the display cylinder, i.e. was not cliped
See Also:
dot(PVector p)

dot

public boolean dot(YPoint yp)
Light a Dot on the display, a YPoint unlike a PVector is not translated and rotated on the matrix stack. Likley you don't want to use this method but rather dot(PVector p) or dot(x,y,z), it is used by other shape primitive to draw more directly in the display object. ALSO draws a point onto the canvas White if it is in the Displays VOLUME, Orange if not, i.e. clipped.

Parameters:
yp - (YPoint) direct point to light
Returns:
true if the point is currently in the display cylinder, i.e. was not cliped
See Also:
dot(PVector p)

pushMatrix

public void pushMatrix()
add a new Identity matrix to the internal matrix stack of the POVDisplay Object

popMatrix

public void popMatrix()
remove the top internal matrix stack of the POVDisplay Object will assert if you remove the last (default) matrix

resetMatrix

public void resetMatrix()
resets BOTH the internal matrix stack to a single identity matrix and calls pApplet.resetMatrix() to reset the processing/canvas matrix

Add a uniform translation to the current/top matrix

Parameters:
s - scale factor 1.0 => unity, 2.0 => double size
